result.execSummary:
All charges against Ezareon Isaiah Allen in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ezareon Isaiah Allen is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ezareon Isaiah Allen

records.addlTxt: On motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody AT Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held. Defense requests prompt disopsition be wavied. For reasons stated on the record, court grants defense request. Defense to e-file waiver.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court places on the record that witness Mr. Jones appeared in court and further discussions. State places discussions with victim on the record. Court vacates order for the state filing by noon. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody.  Dan Flaherty for Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advise of contact with victim again. Discussions held regarding prompt disposition. Defense advises that defendant wishes to waive prompt disposition and will file a written waiver with defendant. Defense requests state provide representations about witness adovcate communication with victim. Court orders state provide statement by witness advocate filed by noon today. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has been unsuccessful in contacting witness and cannot proceed without. Defense is requesting dismissal. Court holds ruling on defense motion to dismiss in abeyance until next court date. Court adjourns jury trial and sets status conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for first call of jury trial. All parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Court passes case to address other trials scheduled.

Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in court (via zoom) with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for . Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in court with Attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017199,
Payable Number: 986719,
Receipt Number: 22RP006952,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. 24 hour curfew with release for medical and dental appointments only. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $20,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Ezareon Isaiah Allen
Current: 4429 N 40th St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 02-12-2022)
Prior: 3939 North 74th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BOJ and DDO.

Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Defendant Ezareon Isaiah Allen in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ezareon Isaiah Allen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
